trans-unit.source: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries
trans-unit.target: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries

trans-unit.source: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.
trans-unit.target: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.

trans-unit.source: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.
trans-unit.target: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.

trans-unit.source: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries
trans-unit.target: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.
trans-unit.target: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.

trans-unit.source: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.
trans-unit.target: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.

trans-unit.source: A library is a virtual collection of folders, which includes a known folder by default plus any other folders the user has added to the library by using your app or one of the built-in apps.
trans-unit.target: A library is a virtual collection of folders, which includes a known folder by default plus any other folders the user has added to the library by using your app or one of the built-in apps.

trans-unit.source: For example, the Pictures library includes the Pictures known folder by default.
trans-unit.target: For example, the Pictures library includes the Pictures known folder by default.

trans-unit.source: The user can add folders to, or remove them from, the Pictures library by using your app or the built-in Photos app.
trans-unit.target: The user can add folders to, or remove them from, the Pictures library by using your app or the built-in Photos app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: Access permissions to the location
trans-unit.target: Access permissions to the location

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the app manifest file in Manifest Designer.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the app manifest file in Manifest Designer.

trans-unit.source: On the **Capabilities** page, select the libraries that your app manages.
trans-unit.target: On the **Capabilities** page, select the libraries that your app manages.

trans-unit.source: Music Library
trans-unit.target: Music Library

trans-unit.source: Pictures Library
trans-unit.target: Pictures Library

trans-unit.source: Videos Library
trans-unit.target: Videos Library

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: Get a reference to a library
trans-unit.target: Get a reference to a library

trans-unit.source: **Note** Remember to declare the appropriate capability.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Remember to declare the appropriate capability.

trans-unit.source: To get a reference to the user's Music, Pictures, or Video library, call the [**StorageLibrary.GetLibraryAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251725) method.
trans-unit.target: To get a reference to the user's Music, Pictures, or Video library, call the [**StorageLibrary.GetLibraryAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251725) method.

trans-unit.source: Provide the corresponding value from the [**KnownLibraryId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298399) enumeration.
trans-unit.target: Provide the corresponding value from the [**KnownLibraryId**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298399) enumeration.

trans-unit.source: KnownLibraryId.Music
trans-unit.target: KnownLibraryId.Music

trans-unit.source: KnownLibraryId.Pictures
trans-unit.target: KnownLibraryId.Pictures

trans-unit.source: KnownLibraryId.Videos
trans-unit.target: KnownLibraryId.Videos

trans-unit.source: Get the list of folders in a library
trans-unit.target: Get the list of folders in a library

trans-unit.source: To get the list of folders in a library, get the value of the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property.
trans-unit.target: To get the list of folders in a library, get the value of the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property.

trans-unit.source: Get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default
trans-unit.target: Get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default

trans-unit.source: To get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default, get the value of the [**StorageLibrary.SaveFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251728) property.
trans-unit.target: To get the folder in a library where new files are saved by default, get the value of the [**StorageLibrary.SaveFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251728) property.

trans-unit.source: Add an existing folder to a library
trans-unit.target: Add an existing folder to a library

trans-unit.source: To add a folder to a library, you call the [**StorageLibrary.RequestAddFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251726).
trans-unit.target: To add a folder to a library, you call the [**StorageLibrary.RequestAddFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251726).

trans-unit.source: Taking the Pictures Library as an example, calling this method causes a folder picker to be shown to the user with an **Add this folder to Pictures** button.
trans-unit.target: Taking the Pictures Library as an example, calling this method causes a folder picker to be shown to the user with an **Add this folder to Pictures** button.

trans-unit.source: If the user picks a folder then the folder remains in its original location on disk and it becomes an item in the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property (and in the built-in Photos app), but the folder does not appear as a child of the Pictures folder in File Explorer.
trans-unit.target: If the user picks a folder then the folder remains in its original location on disk and it becomes an item in the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property (and in the built-in Photos app), but the folder does not appear as a child of the Pictures folder in File Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Remove a folder from a library
trans-unit.target: Remove a folder from a library

trans-unit.source: To remove a folder from a library, call the [**StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251727) method and specify the folder to be removed.
trans-unit.target: To remove a folder from a library, call the [**StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251727) method and specify the folder to be removed.

trans-unit.source: You could use [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) and a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242878) control (or similar) for the user to select a folder to remove.
trans-unit.target: You could use [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) and a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242878) control (or similar) for the user to select a folder to remove.

trans-unit.source: When you call [**StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251727), the user sees a confirmation dialog saying that the folder "won't appear in Pictures anymore, but won't be deleted."
trans-unit.target: When you call [**StorageLibrary.RequestRemoveFolderAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251727), the user sees a confirmation dialog saying that the folder "won't appear in Pictures anymore, but won't be deleted."

trans-unit.source: What this means is that the folder remains in its original location on disk, is removed from the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property, and will no longer included in the built-in Photos app.
trans-unit.target: What this means is that the folder remains in its original location on disk, is removed from the [**StorageLibrary.Folders**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251724) property, and will no longer included in the built-in Photos app.

trans-unit.source: The following example assumes that the user has selected the folder to remove from a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242878) control named **lvPictureFolders**.
trans-unit.target: The following example assumes that the user has selected the folder to remove from a [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242878) control named **lvPictureFolders**.

trans-unit.source: Get notified of changes to the list of folders in a library
trans-unit.target: Get notified of changes to the list of folders in a library

trans-unit.source: To get notified about changes to the list of folders in a library, register a handler for the [**StorageLibrary.DefinitionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251723) event of the library.
trans-unit.target: To get notified about changes to the list of folders in a library, register a handler for the [**StorageLibrary.DefinitionChanged**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn251723) event of the library.

trans-unit.source: Media library folders
trans-unit.target: Media library folders

trans-unit.source: A device provides five predefined locations for users and apps to store media files.
trans-unit.target: A device provides five predefined locations for users and apps to store media files.

trans-unit.source: Built-in apps store both user-created media and downloaded media in these locations.
trans-unit.target: Built-in apps store both user-created media and downloaded media in these locations.

trans-unit.source: The locations are:
trans-unit.target: The locations are:

trans-unit.source: **Pictures** folder.
trans-unit.target: **Pictures** folder.

trans-unit.source: Contains pictures.
trans-unit.target: Contains pictures.

trans-unit.source: **Camera Roll** folder.
trans-unit.target: **Camera Roll** folder.

trans-unit.source: Contains photos and video from the built-in camera.
trans-unit.target: Contains photos and video from the built-in camera.

trans-unit.source: **Saved Pictures** folder.
trans-unit.target: **Saved Pictures** folder.

trans-unit.source: Contains pictures that the user has saved from other apps.
trans-unit.target: Contains pictures that the user has saved from other apps.

trans-unit.source: **Music** folder.
trans-unit.target: **Music** folder.

trans-unit.source: Contains songs, podcasts, and audio books.
trans-unit.target: Contains songs, podcasts, and audio books.

trans-unit.source: **Video** folder.
trans-unit.target: **Video** folder.

trans-unit.source: Contains videos.
trans-unit.target: Contains videos.

trans-unit.source: Users or apps may also store media files outside the media library folders on the SD card.
trans-unit.target: Users or apps may also store media files outside the media library folders on the SD card.

trans-unit.source: To find a media file reliably on the SD card, scan the contents of the SD card, or ask the user to locate the file by using a file picker.
trans-unit.target: To find a media file reliably on the SD card, scan the contents of the SD card, or ask the user to locate the file by using a file picker.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Access the SD card](access-the-sd-card.md).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Access the SD card](access-the-sd-card.md).

trans-unit.source: Querying the media libraries
trans-unit.target: Querying the media libraries

trans-unit.source: Query results include both internal and removable storage
trans-unit.target: Query results include both internal and removable storage

trans-unit.source: Users can choose to store files by default on the optional SD card.
trans-unit.target: Users can choose to store files by default on the optional SD card.

trans-unit.source: Apps, however, can opt out of allowing files to be stored on the SD card.
trans-unit.target: Apps, however, can opt out of allowing files to be stored on the SD card.

trans-unit.source: As a result, the media libraries can be split across the device's internal storage and the SD card.
trans-unit.target: As a result, the media libraries can be split across the device's internal storage and the SD card.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to write additional code to handle this possibility.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to write additional code to handle this possibility.

trans-unit.source: The methods in the [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346) namespace that query known folders transparently combine the query results from both locations.
trans-unit.target: The methods in the [**Windows.Storage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227346) namespace that query known folders transparently combine the query results from both locations.

trans-unit.source: You don't have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file to get these combined results, either.
trans-unit.target: You don't have to specify the **removableStorage** capability in the app manifest file to get these combined results, either.

trans-unit.source: Consider the state of the device's storage shown in the following image:
trans-unit.target: Consider the state of the device's storage shown in the following image:

trans-unit.source: images on the phone and sd card
trans-unit.target: images on the phone and sd card

trans-unit.source: If you query the contents of the Pictures Library by calling `await KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync()`, the results include both internalPic.jpg and SDPic.jpg.
trans-unit.target: If you query the contents of the Pictures Library by calling `await KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync()`, the results include both internalPic.jpg and SDPic.jpg.

trans-unit.source: Deep queries
trans-unit.target: Deep queries

trans-unit.source: Use the deep queries to enumerate the entire contents of a media library quickly.
trans-unit.target: Use the deep queries to enumerate the entire contents of a media library quickly.

trans-unit.source: The deep queries return only files of the specified media type.
trans-unit.target: The deep queries return only files of the specified media type.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you query the Music Library with a deep query, the query results do not include any picture files found in the Music folder.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you query the Music Library with a deep query, the query results do not include any picture files found in the Music folder.

trans-unit.source: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.
trans-unit.target: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.

trans-unit.source: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.
trans-unit.target: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.

trans-unit.source: The following deep queries are available:
trans-unit.target: The following deep queries are available:

trans-unit.source: Pictures library
trans-unit.target: Pictures library

trans-unit.source: Music library
trans-unit.target: Music library

trans-unit.source: Video library
trans-unit.target: Video library

trans-unit.source: Flat queries
trans-unit.target: Flat queries

trans-unit.source: To get a complete listing of all the files and folders in a library, call `GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.DefaultQuery)`.
trans-unit.target: To get a complete listing of all the files and folders in a library, call `GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.DefaultQuery)`.

trans-unit.source: This method returns all files in the library, regardless of their type.
trans-unit.target: This method returns all files in the library, regardless of their type.

trans-unit.source: This is a shallow query, so you have to enumerate the contents of subfolders recursively if the user has created subfolders in the library.
trans-unit.target: This is a shallow query, so you have to enumerate the contents of subfolders recursively if the user has created subfolders in the library.

trans-unit.source: Use flat queries to return media files of types that are not recognized by the built-in queries, or to return all the files in a library, including files that are not of the specified type.
trans-unit.target: Use flat queries to return media files of types that are not recognized by the built-in queries, or to return all the files in a library, including files that are not of the specified type.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you query the Music Library with a flat query, the query results include any picture files found by the query in the Music folder.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you query the Music Library with a flat query, the query results include any picture files found by the query in the Music folder.

trans-unit.source: Sample queries
trans-unit.target: Sample queries

trans-unit.source: Assume that the device and its optional SD card contain the folders and files shown in the following image:
trans-unit.target: Assume that the device and its optional SD card contain the folders and files shown in the following image:

trans-unit.source: files on
trans-unit.target: files on

trans-unit.source: Here are a few examples of queries and the results that they return.
trans-unit.target: Here are a few examples of queries and the results that they return.

trans-unit.source: Query
trans-unit.target: Query

trans-unit.source: Results
trans-unit.target: Results

trans-unit.source: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetItemsAsync();
trans-unit.target: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetItemsAsync();

trans-unit.source: - Camera Roll folder from internal storage
trans-unit.target: - Camera Roll folder from internal storage

trans-unit.source: - Camera Roll folder from the SD card
trans-unit.target: - Camera Roll folder from the SD card

trans-unit.source: - Saved Pictures folder from internal storage
trans-unit.target: - Saved Pictures folder from internal storage

trans-unit.source: - Saved Pictures folder from the SD card
trans-unit.target: - Saved Pictures folder from the SD card

trans-unit.source: This is a flat query, so only immediate children of the Pictures folder are returned.
trans-unit.target: This is a flat query, so only immediate children of the Pictures folder are returned.

trans-unit.source: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync();
trans-unit.target: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync();

trans-unit.source: No results.
trans-unit.target: No results.

trans-unit.source: This is flat query, and the Pictures folder does not contain any files as its immediate children.
trans-unit.target: This is flat query, and the Pictures folder does not contain any files as its immediate children.

trans-unit.source: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.OrderByDate);
trans-unit.target: KnownFolders.PicturesLibrary.GetFilesAsync(CommonFileQuery.OrderByDate);

trans-unit.target: - 4-3-2012.jpg file from the SD card

trans-unit.target: - 1-1-2014.jpg file from internal storage

trans-unit.target: - 1-2-2014.jpg file from internal storage

trans-unit.target: - 1-6-2014.jpg file from the SD card

trans-unit.source: This is a deep query, so the contents of the Pictures folder and of its child folders are returned.
trans-unit.target: This is a deep query, so the contents of the Pictures folder and of its child folders are returned.

trans-unit.source: KnownFolders.CameraRoll.GetFilesAsync();
trans-unit.target: KnownFolders.CameraRoll.GetFilesAsync();

trans-unit.target: - 1-1-2014.jpg file from internal storage

trans-unit.source: - 4-3-2012.jpg file from the SD card
trans-unit.target: - 4-3-2012.jpg file from the SD card

trans-unit.source: This is a flat query.
trans-unit.target: This is a flat query.

trans-unit.source: The ordering of the results is not guaranteed.
trans-unit.target: The ordering of the results is not guaranteed.

trans-unit.source: Media library capabilities and file types
trans-unit.target: Media library capabilities and file types

trans-unit.target: Here are the capabilities that you can specify in the app manifest file to access media files in your app.

trans-unit.target: **Music**.

trans-unit.source: Working with photos
trans-unit.target: Working with photos

trans-unit.source: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.
trans-unit.target: On devices where the camera saves both a low-resolution image and a high-resolution image of every picture, the deep queries return only the low-resolution image.

trans-unit.source: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.
trans-unit.target: The Camera Roll and the Saved Pictures folder do not support the deep queries.

trans-unit.source: Opening a photo in the app that captured it
trans-unit.target: Opening a photo in the app that captured it

trans-unit.source: If you want to let the user open a photo again later in the app that captured it, you can save the **CreatorAppId** with the photo's metadata by using code similar to the following example.
trans-unit.target: If you want to let the user open a photo again later in the app that captured it, you can save the **CreatorAppId** with the photo's metadata by using code similar to the following example.

trans-unit.source: In this example, **testPhoto** is a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171).
trans-unit.target: In this example, **testPhoto** is a [**StorageFile**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227171).

trans-unit.source: Using stream methods to add a file to a media library
trans-unit.target: Using stream methods to add a file to a media library

trans-unit.source: When you access a media library by using a known folder such as **KnownFolders.PictureLibrary**, and you use stream methods to add a file to the media library, you have to make sure to close all the streams that your code opens.
trans-unit.target: When you access a media library by using a known folder such as **KnownFolders.PictureLibrary**, and you use stream methods to add a file to the media library, you have to make sure to close all the streams that your code opens.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise these methods fail to add the file to the media library as expected because at least one stream still has a handle to the file.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise these methods fail to add the file to the media library as expected because at least one stream still has a handle to the file.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you run the following code, the file is not added to the media library.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you run the following code, the file is not added to the media library.

trans-unit.source: In the line of code, `using (var destinationStream = (await destinationFile.OpenAsync(FileAccessMode.ReadWrite)).GetOutputStreamAt(0))`, both the **OpenAsync** method and the **GetOutputStreamAt** method open a stream.
trans-unit.target: In the line of code, `using (var destinationStream = (await destinationFile.OpenAsync(FileAccessMode.ReadWrite)).GetOutputStreamAt(0))`, both the **OpenAsync** method and the **GetOutputStreamAt** method open a stream.

trans-unit.source: However only the stream opened by the **GetOutputStreamAt** method is disposed as a result of the **using** statement.
trans-unit.target: However only the stream opened by the **GetOutputStreamAt** method is disposed as a result of the **using** statement.

trans-unit.source: The other stream remains open and prevents saving the file.
trans-unit.target: The other stream remains open and prevents saving the file.

trans-unit.source: To use stream methods successfully to add a file to the media library, make sure to close all the streams that your code opens, as shown in the following example.
